updates.16 Jan:
Follow our very own Carissa in the art of paper-cutting and crafting, where you'll learn to create a 3D card from nothing but a simple piece of paper!

Join us on 22 Jan for a sweet and simple 90 degree pop-up card tutorial, and/or 29 Jan to learn how to craft a stunning 180 degree pop-up card! 
Taking place on 31 Jan will be our Medium Exploration session, where you'll enjoy creating card display of your choice and imagination, while applying skills you have learned from the previous sharing sessions.

All you'll need to bring along is coloured paper, ruler, pencil & eraser, glue, and a pen knife! 
Sign up now @ https://tinyurl.com/popupcardmaking

#nusarttero #arttero #artteroshares #artterohappenings #nusartterohappenings #artterosharingsessions #papercrafts #papercrafting #papercraftart #popupcard #cardmaking

Bachelor of Environmental Studies Studen.info:
Tak Wei |  Alumnus

After university, I went for Masters in the UK and now I do policy work in NEA about hawker centres (go dabao from there, our hawkers need us now more than ever). For those studying now, BES and university will never provide you with satisfactory answers to life‚Äôs challenges. Rather, environmental issues are crafted as thought exercises (think of 3k word essays) for the purpose of opening our eyes to the dilemmas our systems bring with them, and to offer a space to think critically without needing to worry about ‚Äúwho‚Äôs funding this?‚Äù or worse yet, procurement guidelines.

If I have any advice, learn every moment you can (even outside of BES). Make friends beyond your batch, for they can share how they now think differently from when they first started, or remind you why you started in the first place. Be inquisitive of our status quo, but do it not to please the intellectual in you, but with intent to help those who are vulnerable and marginalized. And most importantly, never let your inexperience now be the reason holding you back from gaining more experience tomorrow.
Bachelor of Environmental Studies Studen.id: Bachelor of Environmental Studies Student Committee_200516
Bachelor of Environmental Studies Studen.org: Bachelor of Environmental Studies Student Committee
Bachelor of Environmental Studies Studen.name: Bachelor of Environmental Studies Student Committee

updates.31 Mar:
iDP Students‚Äô Club is excited to launch a new initiative to help iDP students find internships at startups and we want your inputs to help potential employers find out which job sector interests the student body the most. If you wish to participate in this survey and potentially secure an internship position in one of these startups, please indicate your interest by filling up the form, link in bio. 
The deadline for submission is on 2nd April (Thurs) 1200 hrs. Do note that we will not be able to entertain late submissions as we are working with a tight deadline. 
These information will be provided to the startups, for them to shortlist a group of candidates for the next step in the application process. 
However, as this is our first cycle, we apologize for any delays and inconvenience you might experience during this period. Due to the recent Covid 19 situation, there may be changes in the format of internship and the application process. We will update you accordingly.
updates.29 Mar:
Thank you to those who participated in the week 2 challenges!! The lie is....A, "I love deep-fried food"! The winners have been contacted, congratulations!

This week's challenge is a test of how familiar you are with the iDP stomping ground E2A.

As mentioned in the post, the 3 photos are taken around E2A. Simply guess and comment below what you think are the locations (eg floor, nearest studio etc) in the same order as in the pictures!! ‚è≥ Deadline is on 2 April, Thursday, 2359
üèÜ 5 winners will be selected randomly

Goodluck!

updates.25 Jan:
Attention all coders in local universities! 
If you are up for a challenge to put your coding skills to the test and keen to demonstrate your problem solving skills, join Shopee I‚Äôm the Best Coder! Challenge Campus Edition 2020 happening on 13th March 2020! 
This challenge is free and open to all undergraduate students in local universities. Simply huddle up in a group of 2 to 4 team members and brace yourself for the challenge you don‚Äôt want to miss!

The top 3 teams get to walk away with attractive cash prizes and potential full-time/internship opportunities with Shopee! 
To gear you up for the challenge, Shopee has also prepared exclusive advanced python and data analytics workshops for shortlisted individuals, which are free of charge!

What are you waiting for? Sign up now at https://careers.shopee.sg/bestcoder! 
@lifeatshopee #BestCoderCampus  #TechAtShopee

updates.16 May:
‚ö†Ô∏èFAQ ‚ö†Ô∏è
‚†Ä
‚ùìHow do I join e-CBB?
All you need to do is submit an application (LINK IN BIO), and we will contact you shortly with a link to our Zoom session on either the 28th or 29th of May!
‚†Ä
Note that you must be an INCOMING NUS FRESHMEN in AY20/21 (matriculating THIS YEAR), please ensure you have accepted your NUS offer prior to signing up for e-CBB.
‚†Ä
‚ùìWho will be in the Zoom session?
There will be 5 KR seniors in the session, who are ready to answer any questions you may have!
‚†Ä
If you signed up with your friends and submitted their names in the form, we will do our BESTEST to group you together in the same Zoom session.
‚†Ä
If you signed up alone, don‚Äôt worry! It‚Äôs your chance to make new friends as you‚Äôll be grouped with other freshies.
‚†Ä
‚ùìWhat will we do during the Zoom session?
We have some fun games lined up for all of you, as well as a sharing segment by our seniors followed by a QnA. We promise it‚Äôll be a fun-filled 2 hours!
‚†Ä
‚ùìIf I sign up for e-CBB, do I still have to apply for hall stay on UHMS?
Yes, e-CBB is NOT THE SAME as the official Hall Application on UHMS. Please still complete your Freshmen Application Exercise on UHMS to apply for stay in Kent Ridge Hall.
‚†Ä
‚†Ä
‚ö†Ô∏è If you have any questions or issues with the form, please do not hesitate to drop us a DM on Instagram @KR_NUS‚ö†Ô∏è

Kent Ridge Hall_200528.info:
‚ö†Ô∏èFAQ ‚ö†Ô∏è
‚†Ä
‚ùìHow do I join e-CBB?
All you need to do is submit an application (LINK IN BIO), and we will contact you shortly with a link to our Zoom session on either the 28th or 29th of May!
‚†Ä
Note that you must be an INCOMING NUS FRESHMEN in AY20/21 (matriculating THIS YEAR), please ensure you have accepted your NUS offer prior to signing up for e-CBB.
‚†Ä
‚ùìWho will be in the Zoom session?
There will be 5 KR seniors in the session, who are ready to answer any questions you may have!
‚†Ä
If you signed up with your friends and submitted their names in the form, we will do our BESTEST to group you together in the same Zoom session.
‚†Ä
If you signed up alone, don‚Äôt worry! It‚Äôs your chance to make new friends as you‚Äôll be grouped with other freshies.
‚†Ä
‚ùìWhat will we do during the Zoom session?
We have some fun games lined up for all of you, as well as a sharing segment by our seniors followed by a QnA. We promise it‚Äôll be a fun-filled 2 hours!
‚†Ä
‚ùìIf I sign up for e-CBB, do I still have to apply for hall stay on UHMS?
Yes, e-CBB is NOT THE SAME as the official Hall Application on UHMS. Please still complete your Freshmen Application Exercise on UHMS to apply for stay in Kent Ridge Hall.
‚†Ä
‚†Ä
‚ö†Ô∏è If you have any questions or issues with the form, please do not hesitate to drop us a DM on Instagram @KR_NUS‚ö†Ô∏è

NUS Astronomical Society_200613.info: AstroChallenge is an annual prestigious event co-organized by NUS Astronomical Society and NTU Astronomical Society. It is a highly anticipated competition in the academic year for secondary school, junior college, and polytechnic students interested in astronomy. An expansive range of questions ranging from theoretical astronomy (in the context of Astrophysics) to practical astronomy (in the context of finding stellar objects in the night sky) are posed to challenge the intellectual and technical abilities of participants.
NUS Astronomical Society_200613.name: AstroChallenge 2020

NUS Buddhist Society_200605.info:
Hey everyone!

It‚Äôs the first day of the end of the Circuit Breaker. As we attempt to recalibrate ourselves to search of a new sense of normalcy, there are bound to be struggles along the way. With the benefit of hindsight, what the COVID-19 situation has been, has been an opportunity for us to reflect, and a time for us to work on ourselves. So this Friday, join us for our sharing by Venerable Chuan Guan!

Venerable Chuan Guan was ordained under the Mahayana Tradition, but studied the Pali Canon extensively. 
The topic ‚ÄúCOVID-19: Facing our Aversions‚Äù, is aimed to help better prepare us for the times ahead, that is equally filled with uncertainties. 
The details are as stated below:

Venue: Zoom
Time: 1900
Link in bio

We hope to see you at the talk!

With Metta,
NUSBS 41st MC
NUS Buddhist Society_200605.name: NUS Buddhist Society

NUS Buddhist Society_200612.info:
Hey Everyone!

This Friday, we have invited Venerable Jian Xin to share on the topic, ‚ÄúHelping Others Through Buddhism‚Äù. Venerable Jian Xin pursued Sociology during her undergraduate studies at NUS. She also holds a Master‚Äôs Degree in Buddhist Studies from the University of London, England. Being ordained under the Mahayana tradition, Venerable Jian Xin has made aspirations to walk the Bodhisattva Path since she was 15.

Very often, Buddhists shy away from sharing more about their religion. The teachings of the Buddha have not been encountered by most. Those who have encountered it are embarrassed or are unsure what to share. Therefore, this topic is meant to answer, what then as Buddhists can we do to help others? 
The details are as follows:

Venue: Zoom
Time: 1900
Link: in bio

See you at the talk!

With Metta,
NUSBS 41st MC
NUS Buddhist Society_200612.name: NUS Buddhist Society

NUS Buddhist Society_200619.info:
Hey everyone!

This week, our Dhamma Talks will continue with the topic ‚ÄúBuddha Nature: Are we Buddhas?‚Äù We have invited Venerable Chuan Guan to guide us in the exploration of this exciting topic!

The Buddha Nature, seems to suggest the path of cultivation to be one of self-discovery. To find that inherent goodness within oneself. Yet, as one practises, the Buddha Nature seems to be in contradiction with the Buddhist teaching of non-self... Join us this Friday as we explore further, what is the goal of our cultivation!

Venerable Chuan Guan was ordained under the Mahayana Tradition by Master Miu King. However, he studies the canonical teachings from the Pali Canon. Therefore he often provide views into the various nuances when it comes to Buddhism.

The details are as follows:

Venue: Zoom
Time: 1900
Link in bio

See you at the talk!

With Metta,
NUSBS 41st MC
NUS Buddhist Society_200619.name: NUS Buddhist Society

NUS Buddhist Society_200626.info:
Hey everyone!

This week, our Dhamma Talks will continue with the topic ‚ÄúAttachments: A Taboo in Buddhism‚Äù. We are honoured to have Venerable Chuan Guan share with us for this upcoming session. He was ordained under the Mahayana Tradition by Master Miu King. However, he also studies the canonical teachings from the Pali Canon. Hence, he can often provide an expansive set of views when it comes to Buddhism. 
Attachments.This is a word that Buddhists often come across. Our source of unhappiness comes from attachments over certain things, events or people. Yet, most may continue to live on, without doing anything about it. At the same time, there are some who are all too eager to cut away all attachments. How does one understand the nature of these attachments and strive on with their spiritual pursuits? Join us this Friday to find out more:) The details are as follows:

Venue: Zoom
Date: 26th June 2020
Time: 1900
Link: bit.ly/NUSBS

See you at the talk!

With Metta,
NUSBS 41st MC
NUS Buddhist Society_200626.name: NUS Buddhist Society

NUS Climbing_190323.info:
It‚Äôs us back with SNCS Level 1 Certification! If you‚Äôre an NUS student or staff, and are interested to learn how to belay, look no further as we bring you the Singapore National Climbing Standard (SNCS) Level 1 course!

Dates open for sign-ups: either 23rd or 24th March 2019 (it is a one-day course)

For more information, please visit http://nusclimb.com/courses or sign up now at https://orgsync.com/140428/events/2626620/occurrences/6445811

Hurry! Slots are limited and will be allocated on a first-come-first-served basis. Kindly note that confirmation of the course is subject to the availability of instructors and a sufficient number of participants. An email will be sent out upon confirmation of the course date.

Did Level 1 and gian for more? üßóüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßóüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è If you‚Äôre an NUS student or staff, and are interested to learn beyond the Level 1 course, we are opening dates for a SNCS Level 2 Course this coming June. 
This course builds on the top-rope skills acquired from Level 1 and teaches a progression into lead climbing on artificial climbing walls. Do take note of the requirements before undertaking this more advanced level course.

Dates open for sign-ups: 8th AND 9th June 2019 (it is a TWO-day course)

For more information, please visit http://nusclimb.com/courses or sign up now at https://orgsync.com/140428/events/2732176/occurrences/6562480

updates.17 Oct:
Hello climbers! 
We're well into AY19/20, and we hope that the sem has been well to everybody thus far. 
The next event is coming up, which is our Club Carnival! Here are some teasers to what's in store for you. 
Our dedicated routesetters, led by the Chief Route Setter Kenton have been setting and testing the routes for you to enjoy. Swipe to the end to see our talented CRS.
If you see him, the route setting team or the organising comm around, do give them some thanks for their hard work! 
The first climbing day is already tomorrow so we hope you are prepared - to have fun! :)

updates.20 Jan:
Hello NUS! 
Hope you all are excited as ClimbNUS opens tomorrow :) At the same time, we will be opening signups for the NUS Climbing Club for semester 2 recruitment! 
This will be a limited time recruitment and will be largely first come first serve. If you miss this, our next round of recruitment will be during Student Life Fair at the start of the next academic year. So hurry down tomorrow to USC and be a part of our big family üí™üèºüßóüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüíØ When: 21 Jan, Tuesday from 10am-6pm
Where: USC (near the bouldering wall)
How: Registration will be at the booth only

If you have any questions, please direct them to nusclimb@gmail.com

‚Ä¢

updates.28 May:
Note: Updated post with new sponsors

It‚Äôs finally, FINALLY the end of the semester! Having gone through the gruelling project season, the dreaded Reading Week(s) and surviving Finals, now‚Äôs the time to kick back, relax and celebrate! NUSEG will be hosting an online Post-Finals Celebration this 29-31st May, featuring a myriad of games for you to choose from.

What better way to de-stress from exams than playing with your best buddies and new friends in games like League of Legends, Overwatch, R6 Siege, Smash, Dota 2, Team Fight Tactics and Hearthstone! Join us from the luxuries and comforts of your own rooms, and get to know the NUS Gaming Community :D

Players of all skill levels are welcomed to join! updates.03 Feb:
NUS Guitar Ensemble (GENUS) is back this semester in NUS Arts Festival with Horizons üåà ! This time, we are featuring an unprecedented collaboration with NUS KotoKottoN, where you will get to experience the creative interweaving of music from two different stringed instruments, the guitar and the koto (a traditional Japanese zither). Set in the Edo period of Japanese history üáØüáµ , Variations on Sakura üå∏ will delight you with a unique rendition of the traditional folk song originally written for the koto by Michio Miyagi, a blind composer. The dynamic rainy season of Japan is illustrated through the piece Ame ~ Mizu to Hikari no Fantasia (Fantasia of Rain and Light) ‚òî , which captures both the tranquillity ‚òÅ and turbulence üåä of rain in a single soundscape. In Horizons, we hope to expose you to the complexities of our world through piecing together music from different cultural origins. Together, let us celebrate the ability of music to bring us new ways of seeing and experiencing culture üé≠ ! 
Broaden your cultural horizons with us at University Cultural Centre (UCC) Theatre on 28 March, 7.30 pm! 
Sign up at http://bit.ly/HORIZONS20 now to get your tickets to the show! üé´ 
Public $28 | Full-time students and Friends of CFA 1 for $15, 2 for $25

updates.27 Jan:
Anger üò° like all human emotions, is powerful but transient, and ultimately fleeting, like the minutes of a clock. 
This item is about the emotional crisis the dancers are facing as they go through a prolonged period of anger. They share the unsettling feeling of anger which is controlling and disturbing them. 
The poem expresses the emotional crisis faced as the dancers go through a drawn-out course of exasperation. They question whether this feeling would ever culminate, and if it does, could it assume a potentially worse form?

See the poem by Alvin Pang come alive on the 12 Feb

Register now for FREE to come down and watch our show at 7.30pm, UCC Theatre!

The link is in our bio!

@nusemcc 
@nuscfa
updates.20 Jan:
Terkocak known as "splashed" üí¶ takes a dive in the melancholic dream as written by Abdul Ghani.

The dancers experiences loneliness despite the peacefulness and serene environment surrounding them. An encounter with someone who was marginalised makes them feel even more distressed. Then, the dancers realise that their loneliness is nothing compared to the other person's. 
This dreamy poem is beautifully choreographed by Mrs Santha Bhaskar and brought to the stage by our dancers, so don't miss it!

Register now for FREE to come down and watch our show on 12 Feb 2020 at 7.30pm, UCC Theatre!

The link is in our bio!

@nusemcc
@nuscfa

updates.05 Sep:
NUS Interfaith's biggest event of the semester is here! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è "For When Death Comes" is a safe space for individuals to confront and reflect on their beliefs toward death. As we age, death becomes increasingly pertinent around us. Be it existential issues of death, or of coping with the death of a loved one, NUS Interfaith hopes to provide you with the platform to engage in open dialogue concerning these issues in order to better understand the ways to process and navigate it when it occurs. 
We are pleased to have several guest speakers who work closely with death in their day-to-day life to share with us their invaluable experience and insight gained from this field of work. SWIPE ‚û°Ô∏è to see more information on our guest speakers! 
Held on Friday, 13 September at YIH Student Lounge from 6:30 - 9:30pm. Dinner will be provided! 
Come shape meaning with us. We hope to see you there! 
Sign up link is in the bio!

updates.19 Jan:
NUS Interfaith's first of three events of this semester is on your way! Do good circumstances mean a good life? What defines a good life? What is meaning in your life? Are you living the good life? ü§î ‚ÄúLife‚Äôs Good. What is the Good Life?‚Äù is a space for individuals to reflect on such questions, as to what the most fulfilling life can look like, whilst learning from others how they each lead and find meaning in their own lives. Get ready to go deeper into yourself to find what you are living - and what you can live - for.
-
-
Held on Thursday, 30th Jan 2020 from 6:30 - 9:30 pm at the YIH Student Lounge! Dinner will be provided! ‚û°Ô∏è Register here: tinyurl.com/interfaithTGL3 (link in bio)
updates.15 Jan:
Here are the official public events listed for NUS Interfaith this semester 2 that you can look forward to! Swipe RIGHT ‚û°Ô∏è for more! Do mark these dates down on your calendars:
1. The Good Life (30th Jan)
2. Faith and Sexuality (13th Feb)
3. Political Correctness (12th Mar).
-
More details on the respective events will be released closer to the event date so stay tuned to this page!
-
Also, we are looking for committee members for the respective events! If you are interested in aiding in the planning or executing of these events, do pm us! We hope to see you soon!

updates.27 May:
Day 6 of the Novena to the Holy Spirit
"Every generation of Christians needs to redeem, to sanctify its own time.

In our time we find... those who dream of a new world, more just and more human, and others who ‚Äî discouraged, perhaps, by the failure of their youthful idealism ‚Äî hide themselves in the selfishness of seeking only their own security or remaining immersed in their errors.

To all these men and women, wherever they may be, in their more exalted moments or in their crises and defeats, we have to bring the solemn and unequivocal message of St. Peter in the days that followed Pentecost:  Jesus is the cornerstone, the Redeemer, the hope of our lives. ‚ÄúFor there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we must be saved.‚Äù What powerful words that exhorts us to imitate Christ, who emptied Himself and became human that He may redeem us from our sinfulness. Let us pray and ask the Holy Spirit to reveal to us 1 person He calls us to journey with, and for all the graces that we need to meet them where they are at, in charity and humility.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.

NUS Legion of Mary_200528.info:
Day 6 of the Novena to the Holy Spirit
"Every generation of Christians needs to redeem, to sanctify its own time.

In our time we find... those who dream of a new world, more just and more human, and others who ‚Äî discouraged, perhaps, by the failure of their youthful idealism ‚Äî hide themselves in the selfishness of seeking only their own security or remaining immersed in their errors.

To all these men and women, wherever they may be, in their more exalted moments or in their crises and defeats, we have to bring the solemn and unequivocal message of St. Peter in the days that followed Pentecost:  Jesus is the cornerstone, the Redeemer, the hope of our lives. ‚ÄúFor there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we must be saved.‚Äù What powerful words that exhorts us to imitate Christ, who emptied Himself and became human that He may redeem us from our sinfulness. Let us pray and ask the Holy Spirit to reveal to us 1 person He calls us to journey with, and for all the graces that we need to meet them where they are at, in charity and humility.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.

NUS Legion of Mary_200529.info:
Day 7 of the Novena to the Holy Spirit
"We have been called to penetrate the intimacy of God‚Äôs own life, to know and love God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit, and to love also ‚Äî in that same love of the one God in three divine Persons ‚Äî the angels and all men. "

This has been the desire and plan of God for humanity, right from Creation. God has created us to seek, know and love  Him (CCC 1), albeit in our own unique ways. Let us return to the Garden of Eden with Adam and Eve, and ask the Holy Spirit to give us all the graces that we need to be faithful to the plan of Salvation.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.
NUS Legion of Mary_200529.name: NUS Legion of Mary

updates.28 May:
Day 7 of the Novena to the Holy Spirit
"We have been called to penetrate the intimacy of God‚Äôs own life, to know and love God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit, and to love also ‚Äî in that same love of the one God in three divine Persons ‚Äî the angels and all men. "

This has been the desire and plan of God for humanity, right from Creation. God has created us to seek, know and love  Him (CCC 1), albeit in our own unique ways. Let us return to the Garden of Eden with Adam and Eve, and ask the Holy Spirit to give us all the graces that we need to be faithful to the plan of Salvation.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.

updates.29 May:
Day 8 of the Novena to the Holy Spirit
"Only when we are faithful to grace and determined to place the cross in the centers of our souls, denying ourselves for the love of God, detaching ourselves in a real way from all selfishness and false human security, only then ‚Äî when we live by faith in a real way ‚Äî will we receive the fullness of the great fire, the great light, the great comfort of the Holy Spirit. It is then, too, that souls begin to experience the peace and freedom that Christ has won for us, and that are given to us with the grace of the Holy Spirit. The fruit of the Spirit is: charity, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, long-suffering, mildness, faith, modesty, continency, chastity, and 'where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.'" In our lives, we are profoundly dependent on God. There is a staggering multitude of things beyond our control, which we can only entrust to God, and even for the things that we can control, we often find ourselves too weak to do them, or we find we have no idea what we should do. The Holy Spirit calls on us to abandon all of these things to Him, to let Him take control of our lives in order to lead and transform us into His image. Let us reflect on how God calls us to be docile to the Holy Spirit, to enter into conversation with Him in prayer, and to be united to Christ on the Cross, in order to let the Holy Spirit work in and through us, and bring us the true freedom that only He can grant.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.

NUS Legion of Mary_200531.info:
DAY Nine of the Holy Spirit Novena
‚ÄúBeing God and proceeding from God, the Holy Spirit marks the hearts of those who receive him, as a seal upon wax. In this way, by the communication of his own life and resemblance, he restores nature according to the beauty of the divine model, and returns to us our resemblance to God.‚Äù The Holy Spirit continues to confound us today: His being, His purpose, His connection with us. We are all too familiar with the knowledge that He dwells within us but we cannot say the same about knowing how to deal with it. Perhaps we can work around this by leading a way of life characterised by:

1. Docility - Being a child of God: being able to realise the wonders of God‚Äôs immense love for us in our daily lives, and acknowledge our own smallness and identify our will fully with the will of God. With this, the Holy Spirit in us, our spiritual vitality, will grow, allowing us to be closer to God and form the image of Christ in us more fully.
2. Life of Prayer - Acquiring the habit of conversation with God, of three persons including the Holy Spirit. Constant dialogue with God makes us understand his love more fully and grow in holiness since we become closer with the Holy Spirit, the one who makes us holy.
3. Union with the Cross - Being detached from all selfishness and false human security. As a result of our total abandonment to the will of God, of our seeking only his glory and renouncing ourselves completely, the Holy Spirit will come to us and make us one with him. As Christians, it is in suffering with the Lord that we may also be glorified with him.

Come, O Holy Spirit: enlighten my understanding to know your commands; strengthen my heart against the wiles of the enemy; inflame my will‚Ä¶ I have heard your voice, and I don‚Äôt want to harden my heart to resisting, by saying ‚Äòlater‚Ä¶ tomorrow.‚Äô Nunc coepi! Now! Lest there be no tomorrow for me! O, Spirit of truth and wisdom, Spirit of understanding and counsel, Spirit of joy and peace! I want what you want, I want it because you want it, I want it as you want it, I want it when you want it.
NUS Legion of Mary_200531.name: NUS Legion of Mary

updates.17 Jan:
Have you ever wondered what to do when someone is drowning? Or would you simply like to make new friends while learning a new set of skills? NUS Lifeguard Corps offers lifesaving courses and CPR lessons to equip you with the necessary skills to become a competent lifesaver!

If you are still unsure, fret not! Come on down for our 2 free trial lessons, for you to get a taste of what we offer before committing to it.

Date: 29/3/20, Wed
Time: 7-9pm
Location: USC pool
Things to bring: swimming costume, towel, toiletries

Our lifesaving classes are held every Mon & Wed (excluding public holidays). Do sign up at https://nus.campuslabs.com/engage/submitter/form/start/381272 . 
For any queries, feel free to drop us a DM on our Facebook or Instagram page.

Link also on our profile!!üèäüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèäüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Dear Life Sciences Majors, 
Hope you are enjoying your summer so far! As per the past few semesters, Life Sciences Society (LSS) is collecting reviews for LSM2XXX, LSM3XXX and LSM4XXX elective modules, to be collated and displayed in our module review repository. This would help you get more opinions on the LSM electives you would like to take in the upcoming semester. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Help us build this database! Submit module reviews by 10th July 2020 and stand a chance to win a $10 Starbucks card. Each unique module review submitted will give you one additional chance in the lucky draw. More detail is in the submission form! Contribute short anonymous reviews (<5 minutes) of LSM2XXX, LSM3XXX and LSM4XXX modules which you have taken in the past semester by filling up this really short and simple form: 
Review Submission Link -  https://tinyurl.com/LSSModReview1920-2 ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Lastly, check out the repository using the following link: 
https://tinyurl.com/LSS2k3k4kModRep ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä¬†‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Thank you for the reviews and we wish you a great semester ahead!

updates.09 Mar:
NUSMSS and Malay Heritage Foundation presents: History & Power: Portrayal of the Malay Community

This event marks the first segment of our two-part Sembang Ilmu Series which is organised by community leaders and members of the Malay community ‚Äì specifically to educate our youths on their Malay heritage. To start off the series, the Malay Studies Society (MSS) will begin with an event on the theme of Sejarah or History, where we will explore the history and historiography of the Malays in Singaporeüá∏üá¨. Aimed at post-secondary/tertiary students and undergraduates, the event will explore how different narratives have come to form, and how contemporary discourse have affected the way history has been written and told.

Joining us as a guest speaker, we have Muhammad Suhail Mohamed Yazid, a Masters graduate of the Department of Malay Studies and a current research assistant at the Institute of Southeast Asian Studies (ISEAS-Yusof Ishak Institute).
üóì Saturday, 14 March 2020
‚è∞ 11:00AM ‚Äì 1:30PM (Registration begins at 10.30am; please be seated by 10.50am)
üìçLocation: Book Cafe at Amazing Chambers Singapura, 73 Sultan Gate, Singapore 198497

Register at http://bit.ly/HistoryAndPower or head to our bio for the clickable link! See you there!‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

NUS Muslim Society_200525.info:
Rihlah 1441H is a sports-based initiative which is organized by volunteers for the National University of Singapore Muslim Society. Our ad hoc aims to promote a healthy lifestyle during the Circuit Breaker period, while simultaneously acting as a platform for the participants to gain knowledge about Islam. Our events target the general public, with the use of social media platforms. At the end of these events, we hope that the participants will benefit and gain useful knowledge, experiences, values and friendship.
Event 2: Circuit Break-a-Sweat
Circuit Break-a-Sweat will serve as a conduit to participants showcasing their personal strengths, abilities and perseverance. We hope that our event will build on the physical, mental and spiritual strength that they need to get through this difficult period. This activity will unlock a tenacious mindset that inspires participants to give their best even if they have little to offer, as participants will be exposed to the notion that even their seemingly insignificant actions can reap rewards and aid others.
Our belief system (Iman) acts as a source of motivation for our participants to be consistent with their commitments and push themselves further. Similarly, we want to emphasize the importance of  consistency when it comes to performing obligatory acts such as the 5 daily prayers. We will remind them of the power and significance of our obligatory acts and encourage them to have faith in themselves and God.
 We aim to provide a platform for participants to develop their faith in a warm, welcoming manner. The participants will be able to showcase their passion for exercise as well as their creativity through their submissions. Through this, we plan on reinforcing our core principles, Iman and Islam.
NUS Muslim Society_200525.name: Rihlah 1441H Event 2: Circuit Break-A-Sweat

NUS Muslim Society_200606.info: JCH Day is a day of activities and performances to allow the youth to take ownership and responsibility in the execution of the performances, help the youth uncover their strengths in planning, performing, team-building, etc. as well as instil the importance of showing graciousness to those around them.
NUS Muslim Society_200606.name: Valour 2019: JCH Day

updates.08 Sep:
And... It's a wrap!

OLIS 2 is over, and this concludes our very last event as the 34th exco. It has been a pleasure organising events for all our participants over this past year!

Next up on the agenda will be our Annual General Meeting (AGM) where we will pass the torch down to the 35th exco.

If you are still interested in signing up as an exco member, do hurry as the deadline to submit an application is next Friday, 13th September.

If you've ever been interested in planning outdoor activities then now's your chance! Experience isn't necessary, just a positive attitude and willingness to learn is! If you have any questions, do feel free do dm or email us with them!

Our AGM will be held on 20 September, where the new exco will be revealed. We encourage all members to come down to see what we have done, what our plans for the future will be, and to meet some old friends you may have met at previous events.

We hope to see you there!

President
Vice-President
Treasurer 
General Secretary

More details about the job scope of the respective positions can be found in the form here: https://nus.campuslabs.com/engage/submitter/form/start/413057

updates.11 Oct:
Great news! Applications for the organising committee of the 17th edition of Singapore Model United Nations (SMUN) are now open!

SMUN is the annual flagship conference of the National University of Singapore (NUS) Political Science Society. Having concluded yet another successful run on 10 - 13 June this year, we are once again looking for individuals to join our team and organise next year's edition of the conference.

From operations management, administration and graphic design, we hope to assemble a team dedicated to making this conference as much of a blast as the last one! We are looking for you to join us in organising an extraordinary conference, without any prior organisational or MUN experience required.

If you're interested and willing to learn and grow on the job, simply head over to tinyurl.com/SMUN2020secre to apply directly! Applications close 20 October 2019, so do submit ASAP before the opportunity passes! *Please contact secretarygeneral@singaporemun.org for any queries.

updates.27 Sep:
Is the environment and the economy a zero sum game? What is the most efficient policy to tackle climate change? Can climate change and environmental degradation even be prevented? How should the transboundary haze be combated? What part should Singapore play in environmental politics and are our current actions sufficient? 
If you have anything to say broadly regarding the topic of environmental politics and climate change in Singapore and even the region, or would like to share your experience, our publications team is compiling Op-Eds. So, drop us an Op-Ed and let your voice be heard! Email us an opinion piece by 3rd November at publications@nuspssoc.org 
Separately, the publications team is also looking for people interested to join the directorate! If that‚Äôs you, please drop us an email at publications@nuspssoc.org

updates.07 Aug:
SEMINAR: MEET DAY 101 .
(REPOST)
Hey fam! Our Training and Education Department has organised a seminar for the #TOS19 competitors. Having a wealth of experience in powerlifting meets, Joel ( @joelchanyy ) and Terence ( @terencehasone_r ), who had also just competed in the Worlds Classic Powerlifting Championships 2019, will be the speakers for the seminar! They will be guiding you through details on how to prepare for a powerlifting meet and they will be covering on topics such as nutrition, psychology, and strategy. NUS Psychology Society_200910.info:
Hi friends! ü§óWe hope everyone is keeping well and staying healthy, both physically and mentally, during this trying time. To cheer yall‚Äôs up, here‚Äôs some very exciting news! üòÜ
.
Resilience Collective x NUS Psychology Society are organising an exciting human library event this September, focusing on unspoken stories of mental health and mental wellness. We are inviting NUS students and staff who are open to sharing their personal story or journey of resilience and overcoming mental health challenges, to be part of this unique library! üòä
.
üñºEvent: A Library of Unspoken Stories (NUS Edition)
üìÖDate: 10 Sep 2020 (World Suicide Prevention Day)
‚è∞Time: 2 - 6pm
üè¢Venue: NUS Central Library, Level 1
This human library event will provide an exciting opportunity for the NUS community to connect one-on-one with individuals who will share their unique set of life experiences, stories, and knowledge. This library aims to focus on mental well-being stories relevant to the student community such as academic pressure, burnout, relationships, transitions, coping & recovery, and more. Through positive, personal dialogue, the library‚Äôs goals are to encourage new ideas and ways of thinking, to celebrate differences, reduce mental health stigma and to promote community building.
.
‚ùóÔ∏èRegister your interest to be a human book at the link in our bio now‚ùóÔ∏è
**Training will be provided on how to share your story effectively. More details will be shared with registrants in due course.
NUS Psychology Society_200910.name: NUS Psychology Society

updates.26 Feb:
For our second trek this semester, we decided to embark on a trek on the remote side of Singapore, on the Bukit Brown Heritage Trail!
.
We met bright and early at 8am on a Saturday morning at Botanic Gardens MRT, before starting our short trek to Bukit Brown. There, we met our guides who would bring us around Bukit Brown and tell us about its history, from war stories to stories of upbringing and royalty. As we moved through the paved and off-beat trails, we learned about the different kinds of graves and their layouts. We understood that they weren't just graves, but the story of a person‚Äôs life. After the trail, we could better appreciate the importance of Bukit Brown as a heritage site in Singapore.
.
We would like to give a special thanks to Beng Tat and Fabian from All Things Bukit Brown (a.t.bukitbrown) for sharing with us about the rich history of Bukit Brown. Overall, it was a lovely morning spent outdoors with friends exploring a rustic piece of our history. -Yangjie, PD üë£üçÉ

updates.01 Mar:
Dear adventurers,
.
Due to the escalating COVID-19 situation, NUS has suspended all co-curricular activities till 22 March 2020, after which the policy would be subject to further review.
.
In adherence to these measures, Rovers Adventure Club will be postponing all treks until further notice is given by the school. Moreover, given that the COVID-19 is still fluid and evolving, all future plans for Summer Treks will have to be reevaluated, once again subject to clearance from the school.
.
We seek your understanding in this matter and rest assured that we would resume activities as soon as possible! In the meantime, please be mindful of your personal hygiene and stay healthy!
.
Thank you :) üë£üçÉ

NUS Statistics Society_200518.info:
Dear students,

TerraAI are organizing a chatbot competition for students who want to learn basic NLP. See the write-up below for more information.

Best regards,
NUS Statistics Society

Hi NUS Students,

Looking for stay-at-home learning opportunities and growing your portfolio this summer? Let‚Äôs build a bot!

Build-A-Bot 2020 (https://ai4impact.org/bb.html) aims to help you learn fundamental NLP concepts and end-to-end chatbot development. It is a bootcamp + competition where you can learn and develop meaningful chatbots to help humanity

Here are some simple chatbot examples. By the end of the bootcamp, you should be able to create far better chatbots than these! You can go as far as imagination takes you!

Foodie 
Jiejie Calorie Bot - (https://app.smojo.org/christian/foodiejiejiebot)
Humbot the Humor Bot - (https://app.smojo.org/christian/humbot)
Trumpbot (for entertainment purposes only) (https://app.smojo.org/christian/trumpbot)

Your Build-A-Bot Journey: 
1. Virtual Bootcamp - 18 May Launch (self-paced learning): 6 virtual sessions with mentorship on building chatbots.

2. Chatbot Development (20 - 31 May): Build a chatbot with your team, under mentorship of AI experts

3. Contest! (1 - 6 June): We open access for public to interact with your chatbots and upvote if they like it (until and including 6th June 2020).s

Sounds interesting? Go to https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/build-a-bot-2020-chatbot-4-humanity-open-category-tickets-103589593262  to sign up!

P.S. Special 66% discounts for NUS students (Code: NUSBOT2020) -> from $15 to $5 - Deadline: 15th May 2020

Build-A-Bot 2020 is organized by ai4impact, a Deep Learning training partner of NUS Faculty of Science for IoT Datathon series (https://www.science.nus.edu.sg/blog/2020/02/12/8107/). Their aim is to make AI accessible to everyone, regardless of your technical background. Find out more at http://ai4impact.org/index.html or contact them at ai4impact@gmail.com.
NUS Statistics Society_200518.name: NUS Statistics Society

NUS Statistics Society_200801.info:
Over 6000 coders are up for the Shopee Code League. If you have not signed up for Shopee Code League, you are missing out on being part of the largest code-from-home league in the region!

Shopee Code League is happening from 8 June to 1 August and we are calling out to all students and professionals across the region, to compete in a series of coding challenges specially designed by our Shopee tech teams.

Join us as we dive into real world data problems and upskill with our exclusive training workshops. It is free and all you need to do is to form a team of 2-4. And who knows, your team could emerge victorious in the Top 10 and walk away with over SGD20,000 of cash prizes!

Time is ticking! Sign up today at careers.shopee.sg/codeleague to be a part of the coding event of the year.

#ShopeeCodeLeague #TechAtShopee

ENTER: BreakiNUS Internal Jam 2019 ‚òÑÔ∏èüóØü§Ø
Only 3 more days to our annual BreakiNUS Internal Jam! üí•

For our next judge, we have our very own Ivan! Here‚Äôs some words of wisdom from our semester class instructor ü§©:
.
>When did you start breaking?

Started in 2009 first by YouTube, then found a group of friends in school to train with
.
>What is breaking to you?

A form of expression of the music
.
>What would you look out for when judging?

In my opinion, for any dance, there are 2 basic yet important aspects: Music and form. You have to listen to the music and look good(execution/clarity in movements)
.
>What advice would you give to the freshies who are attending the jam for the first time?

Don't think so much and just have fun!
___

updates.15 Nov:
ENTER: BreakiNUS Internal Jam 2019 ‚òÑÔ∏èüóØü§Ø
.
Only 2 more days to our annual BreakiNUS Internal Jam! üí•

Introducing our final bboy on the judges‚Äô seats, we have Erin from Cypher Crazed! Here‚Äôs what the former YouTube star has for you:
.
>When did you start breaking?

2009
.
>What is breaking to you?

Started out for fun, then took it seriously as an avenue to challenge myself and set my mind free
.
>What would you look out for when judging?

Technique, finesse
.
>What advice would you give to the freshies who are attending the jam for the first time?

Keep clean, don't crash, plan ahead what u want to do
___

updates.13 Nov:
ENTER: BreakiNUS Internal Jam 2019 ‚òÑÔ∏èüóØü§Ø Only 4 more days to our annual BreakiNUS Internal Jam! üí• 
Introducing our very first judge, Si Quan! Popularly known as SQ, here‚Äôs what he has to say!
> When did you start breaking?
2008.
.
>What is breaking to you?
A hobby, a distraction from work, a break from stress, an exercise, a time to create, a metaphor for life, a place to progress and learn.
.
>What would you look out for when judging?
Cleanliness, style, originality, musicality.
.
>What advice would you give to the freshies who are attending the jam for the first time?
Let's be honest. You're a uni student. You're studying computer science, engineering, economics, business, etc. You may have a plan for the future and that likely does not involve breaking. 
So, make the jam fun for yourself. This is an internal jam, not a competitive one. Everyone's your friend or friendly. Enjoy the music, enjoy the vibes, have a dance conversation with your friends. 
This jam says nothing about you. If you lose, it doesn't mean you are bad. If you win, it doesn't mean you're good. It's for fun. So, just enjoy it. 
Lastly, if you're prepping for the jam, focus on two things. Your foundational moves and executing them well. You're still young, still learning. Things like style, flava, originality don't matter for you yet. Make sure your foundation's good and you're doing them properly. Take this week to drill it. 
Doing the simplest things is sometimes the hardest :)
___

updates.25 Jun:
Theme for CCS 2020: Remembering, Renewing, Reinventing

While Singapore‚Äôs remarkable achievements as a Global City with world-class infrastructures deserve to go down in history as having accomplished so much in 54 years, we can never rest on our laurels and expect the same successes to repeat themselves!

Moving forward into a new decade, what are some key takeaways in which we can apply to the future needs of our rapidly evolving metropolis? How can we preserve our urban heritage and yet with so little space, so little resources and so little time, how can we enhance and sustain the liveability of the Lion City? Through the essay questions provided on which you will research and pen down your response, we hope that it can stimulate greater interest, curiosity and creativity in analysing our urban legacy.

And what is a competition without some attractive prizes? The prizes include:

1st place: AirPods with Charging Case

2nd place: $100 worth of Grabfood delivery credits

3rd place: $50 worth of book vouchers

So what are you waiting for? Sign up now at www.bit.ly/nuspaccs

NUS Students' Sports Club_200712.name: Sports Club's Virtual Series
NUS Students' Sports Club_200712.info: Sports Club's Virtual Series comprise a virtual Swim & Run component and a Cycle & Run component. This new project is part of Sports Club's Ruby Jubilee instalment, where medals from NUS Biathlon, SunNUS and RunNUS will chain together, forming a collectible series. The race will be held from 13 Jul to 16 Aug 2020 via a virtual manner. Participants' entitlements will be mailed to them at the end of the race period, after verifying all race submissions.

NUS Students' Sports Club_200918.info:
RunNUS is the largest running event happening annually across all the universities and is one of the most popular running events organised by the NUS Students’ Sports Club. RunNUS takes place in September every year, and comprises both the NUS community and the public. This year, RunNUS is part of the NUS115 Celebrations, to commemorate NUS 115th birthday. In RunNUS’ 14th year running, our objective of “Inclusivity, Community, Unity” and tagline of “Run For A Cause” aims to integrate People with Disabilities and Special Needs (PWDSNs) into the community through running and also to promote a healthy lifestyle among the NUS population, as well as the general public.  
This year, in light of the COVID-19 situation, we have decided to transit into a virtual run from 19 to 27 September, with distances of 3km, 5km and 10km. The 3km and 5km run are to be done in 1 go while the 10km run can be completed cumulatively with a minimum of 3km each submission. Participants' entitlements will be mailed to them at the end of the race period, after verifying all race submissions.For our beneficiaries, we will be partnering with Singapore Disability Sports Council (SDSC) and Disabled People’s Association (DPA) to champion our cause. Net proceeds from runners’ fee and donations pledged will be channelled towards supporting our beneficiaries.
NUS Students' Sports Club_200918.name: RunNUS 2020

NUS Students' Sports Club_200919.info:
Splashdown is an annual project organised by the NUS University Lifeguard Corps.
Mass swim

To foster interest and awareness in swimming
3 hours to swim as many laps as possible
At the end of their swim, participants are able to claim lap gifts depending on the total number of laps they swim.
Participants who complete a minimum of 100 laps will be awarded a finisher T-shirt.
Novice category open to NUS participants 

Lifesaving booths

To promote lifesaving as a sport and as a skill
5 station games that will be add to their lap count upon completion
NUS Students' Sports Club_200919.name: Splashdown 2020

National University of Singapore Student.info:
NUSSU Rag & Flag is an annual charity project organised by the Union to raise donations for Community Chest (ComChest), the fundraising and engagement arm of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS).
 
FLAG DAYS - SERVICE
Throughout June and July, NUS students plan and organise engagements with 22 charity programmes under various Social Service Agencies (SSAs). They then participate in flagging, over 5000 students from NUS travel all over Singapore on 2 separate days to flag for donations from the public. The proceeds are disbursed by ComChest to the SSAs whom our students engaged with over the summer.
 
RAG DAY - GRATITUDE
The RAG in NUSSU Rag & Flag Day is also known as the Receive and Give (RAG) Day. Our event features colourful, vibrant performances by our students to show gratitude to our Singaporean community in supporting our fundraising efforts in Flag. Our family friendly carnival styled event is open to the public, all proceeds from the carnival will contribute to the fundraising for ComChest.
National University of Singapore Student.org: National University of Singapore Students' Union
National University of Singapore Student.id: National University of Singapore Students' Union_200331
National University of Singapore Student.name: NUSSU Rag & Flag 2020

updates.23 Jun:
We are currently in the works of a Red Cross Youth website and it will be launched very soon! üéâüéâ It will feature our projects and senior reviews about it. Today, we have Hui Ya from Project Smiles to share to share her experience. ‚ò∫‚ò∫
.
Frequency of events held in a year for the project: Every alternate Sunday, 10 am-1 pm
.
Why should they join your project and what‚Äôs interesting about your project:
.
With the recent circuit breaker measures, how many of y‚Äôall felt bored at home and were counting down to the number of days left? üò© Luckily, we have apps like Houseparty to video call and play games with our friends!! ü§™ .
However, what if we had no access to these apps? We won‚Äôt have anyone to socialize with. Now imagine being in that situation for a long time to come.
.
This is what our residents face every day. At the Red Cross Home for the Disabled (RCHD), our friendly residents, who are also mentally and physically disabled, have physical restrictions and limited opportunities to interact with people.
.
Like us, they have their own interests ü§ì They love ball games, coloring, and singalong sessions, and are willing to connect with people from all walks of life!!
.
However, they do not have regular activities organized to fill their weekends. This is where you can MAKE A DIFFERENCE ü§©
.
Join our family in becoming the special someone who brings smiles onto their faces!! Here at Project Smiles, we don't just volunteer. We grow together into confident and emphatic people who are always ready to serve our community üíû .
Don‚Äôt fret if you don‚Äôt know how!! We will help each other along the way so be brave and take that first step!! üë£
.
Are you game for the challenge? üòâüòé
.
Why should they join RCY:
.
Beyond our cozy Project Smiles family, we also belong to a bigger family, the NUS RCY family!! Here, you'll find many like-minded and unique individuals who will spice up your uni life!! üî• Come join in the fun and you‚Äôll find your kakis for life here üòúü§üüèº We hope to see you guys soon!!
.
We would like to thank Hui Ya for taking the time to write about her experience! Do keep an eye out for updates about our website as it will go live soon. üôåüôå

Rovers Adventure Club_200322.info:
Dear adventurers,
.
Due to the escalating COVID-19 situation, NUS has suspended all co-curricular activities till 22 March 2020, after which the policy would be subject to further review.
.
In adherence to these measures, Rovers Adventure Club will be postponing all treks until further notice is given by the school. Moreover, given that the COVID-19 is still fluid and evolving, all future plans for Summer Treks will have to be reevaluated, once again subject to clearance from the school.
.
We seek your understanding in this matter and rest assured that we would resume activities as soon as possible! In the meantime, please be mindful of your personal hygiene and stay healthy!
.
Thank you :) üë£üçÉ

[SSWS Special Projects- SSWS x HOME Outreach Event]‚Å£
‚Å£
Ever wondered how migrant domestic workers experience exploitation, racism, abuse in Singapore? Some endured consistent denial of their salaries, unreasonable restriction of food, phone usage or off days, or even verbal and physical abuse.‚Å£
‚Å£
Get to know the struggles of vulnerable migrants first hand through a interactive and insightful engagement session. We will also learn how Humanitarian Organisation for Migration Economics (HOME) protects, empowers and supports these migrants!‚Å£
‚Å£
Refreshments will be provided. ‚Å£
‚Å£

‚Å£

Student Life @ School of Business_200613.name: The NUS MBA Diversity & Inclusion Club presents Digital Leadership: The New Normal
Student Life @ School of Business_200613.info:
The Covid-19 pandemic has created a shift in the preferences and expectations of individuals as citizens, as employees, and as consumers.


How can leaders effectively transform their organizations in this world where Digital Leadership is expected to become the new normal?


#Digital #Leadership is an inaugural webinar, organized by W-Influence - a platform for men and women promoting #female #leadership.


W-Influence is founded among 3 top universities in Asia, namely #CEIBS, #NUS, and #HKUST. Our purpose is to make a difference in the inclusion of women in business by creating a platform for you to leverage a community of top Asian business schools, professional networks, and organisations.


You don’t want to miss this, so see more details and sign up here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/w-influence-digital-leadership-tickets-106605435728

Student Life @ School of Business_200623.name: The NUS MBA Entrepreneurship Club presents "The PwC Perspective by Mr Greg Unsworth, Risk Assurance and Digital Business Leader, PwC Singapore"
Student Life @ School of Business_200623.info: Find out from Mr Greg Unsworth what the outlook for Singapore and APAC is following the impact of Covid-19 Crisis on the start-up ecosystem.
